alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 9:44PM EST until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At McConnelsville affecting Washington and Morgan Counties. For the Muskingum River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River At McConnelsville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.6 feet, Most primary roads flooded in and between McConnelsville and Zanesville; several cottage-type homes are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EST Tuesday was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening and then begin rising again Thursday evening. It will then rise above flood stage early Friday morning to 11.9 feet Saturday morning. It will then start to fall again. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.9 feet on 04/16/1922. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 945 AM EST.
